### Steps to reproduce

I've installed PS enabling contextual menu integration. After autoupgrade contextual menu disappears.

### Expected behavior

```console
After auto autoupgrade all setup options should be stay as they was during first setup process.
```


### Actual behavior

```console
Contextual menu disappears after auto upgrade.
```

```powershell
Windows 10 22H2 x64
```

comments.author: StevenBucher98
comments.body: Thanks @tmm360! What operation did you add to the context menu? Just a open PowerShell here? Also between what versions of PowerShell did this happen?

comments.author: tmm360
comments.body: During the setup, I choose to add the option "open here". I've noticed this now with the upgrade to 7.2.7, but also with previous versions.

comments.author: kilasuit
comments.body:
2 key questions
- How did you install?
  - I'm guessing using the MSI or MSIX
- How did you upgrade? 
  - i,e, was it via Windows Update or via effectively an install over the existing version via MSI/MSIX?

comments.author: tmm360
comments.body: Installed with MSI, upgraded with Windows Update, I think. I found it upgraded.

title: Contextual menu disappears after PS auto upgrade
